alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 3:33PM EDT until July 03 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Currituck County in northeastern North Carolina... The southeastern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The southeastern City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 332 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Back Bay, or 8 miles south of Virginia Beach, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Back Bay around 340 PM EDT. Princess Anne around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Dam Neck, Mount Pleasant, Munden, Sigma, Pungo and Sandbridge Beach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach
